examples: His bravado cost him the job.
He needs no bravado to mesmerize spectators.
It was brazen of him to say so.
They showed a brazen disregard for her privacy.
The case of the pesticide plant reflects brazen discrimination.
He was startled by the brazen notes of the horns.
Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its brevity.
That, and the relative brevity and insecurity of modern jobs, means your CV has to work harder than ever.
I decided that brevity would be as much appreciated as eloquence.
Its virtue resides in its clarity and brevity.
His style is characterized by brevity.
The demagogue has won people's support.
It also exposed Mr Thaksin as a demagogue who is ready to incite a revolt from his Dubai redoubt.
The troops were thoroughly demoralized by this set-back.
Each attack is designed to demoralize our people and divide us from one another.

chineseMeaning: v. 挣扎;笨拙的做; 比目鱼
examples: His flounder in pain and sufferings dying.
No one can flout the law with impunity.
They flouted all our offers of help and friendship.
The foolish boy flout his mother's advice.
A glutton derives sensual pleasures from eating.
In the appeasement of the glutton they have to practise much stimulation.

chineseMeaning: vt. 狼吞虎咽;很快用完
examples: As he was still hungry, he gobbled up a second sandwich.
She gobbled up all the relevant information.
The government seems to gobble up the taxpayers' money.
But this lance head gives us the feeling that it's not consistent because of the goldbrick.
They quickly stripped me of my clothes and bound me like a mummy in a gossamer web.
Gossamer is floating in calm air.

chineseMeaning: n. 建立 恢复;和解;
examples: Mr Brown has inherited the British-Libyan rapprochement engineered by Tony Blair.
There now seems little chance of rapprochement between the warring factions.

chineseMeaning: adj. 全神贯注的;入迷的
examples: We listened to her amazing story with rapt attention.
There was a rapt look on his face whenever he looked at his sweetheart.
The two of them lay rapt and attentive.

chineseMeaning: n. 疹子;大量; adj. 鲁莽的;轻率的;
examples: While you have this rash you are still infectious.
A rash has appeared on his body.
The heat brought him out in a rash.
As soon as popular songs were accepted, fans appeared in a rash
Students made a rash of complaints.
Luckily, flashes of such strong radiation occur so far away they will not scorch our planet.

chineseMeaning: n. 伤口;粉碎;消灭;阻止;
examples: The doctor scotched her false story.
Facts will eventually scotch these rumours.
That scowl he's wearing on his face should tell you so.
The boss manifested his disgust with a scowl.

chineseMeaning: adj. 感情强烈的;猛烈的;
examples: They expressed a vehement protest.
He slammed the door with a vehement fury.
She made a vehement attack on the government's policies.
The furniture is made of plywood covered in teak veneer.
Much modern furniture is not solid but using a sandwich of wood veneer on plywood.
The panel had a veneer of gold and ivory.
He has a veneer of friendliness.
I considered him to be far more veneer than substance.

chineseMeaning: adj. 可原谅的 轻微的;
examples: The venial sins are relatively minor and more easily forgiven.
Her poverty had been a venial fault for two gallant gentlemen.
